abstract.text: This page gives you an overview of all sessions that have no notes yet. Many opportunities to contribute!

The worldwide reach of the App Store means that your app can be enjoyed by people from around the globe. Explore ways to make your app useful and appealing to as many people as possible. And pick up simple techniques for avoiding common issues when reaching a global audience.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Designing for a Global Audience
Enabling Your App for CarPlay

abstract.text: Understand how to enable your audio, messaging, VoIP calling or automaker app for CarPlay. Audio, messaging and VoIP calling apps use a consistent design thatâ€™s optimized for use in the car. Automaker apps provide vehicle specific controls and displays to keep drivers connected without leaving CarPlay. Explore best practices and learn about the tools and frameworks for CarPlay apps.

Discover how you can limit your power usage and help people get even more out of your app. Weâ€™ll show you how you can reduce battery drain from your app by making four key changes to your code. Learn how to add Dark Mode to your app and benefit from OLED displays, audit frame rates from secondary animations, limit background data processing, and defer long running tasks.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Power down: Improve battery consumption

abstract.text: Learn how to identify, load, display, and create High Dynamic Range (HDR) still images in your app. Explore common HDR concepts and find out about the latest updates to the ISO specification. Weâ€™ll also take you through CoreGraphics support for ISO HDR and share best practices for HDR adoption.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Support HDR images in your app

abstract.text: Learn how to take advantage of the power of SwiftUI in your UIKit app. Build custom UICollectionView and UITableView cells seamlessly with SwiftUI using UIHostingConfiguration. Weâ€™ll also show you how to manage data flow between UIKit and SwiftUI components within your app.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Use SwiftUI with UIKit

abstract.text: Discover the latest updates to the Vision framework to help your apps detect people, faces, and poses. And learn how these capabilities can be combined with other APIs like Core Image to deliver anything from simple virtual backgrounds to rich offline compositing in an image-editing app.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Detect people, faces, and poses using Vision

abstract.text: Discover how you can enhance and personalize your app using MusicKit. Weâ€™ll take you through the latest additions to the MusicKit framework and explore how you can bring music content to your app through requests, metadata, and more.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Explore more content with MusicKit

abstract.text: Discover all the different ways you can transform your iOS app into a great macOS experience. Weâ€™ll explore best practices for bringing your app to the Mac, whether you ship an iPad app for M1 Macs or build something for all Macs using Mac Catalyst. Weâ€™ll also show you how you can optimize your app for the Mac, and find out how desktop class iPad features automatically transform into Mac-native options when built using Mac Catalyst.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Bring your iOS app to the Mac

Weâ€™ll also show you how to improve scene processing and rendering through GPU-driven meshlet culling.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Explore game input in visionOS

Weâ€™ll show you how to use samples to easily train a Core ML model to identify human actions like jumping jacks, squats, and dance moves. Learn how this is powered by the Body Pose estimation features of the Vision Framework. Get inspired to create apps that can provide coaching for fitness routines, deliver feedback on athletic form, and more.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Developing CarPlay Systems, Part 2

abstract.text: Learn how CarPlay integrates with your carâ€™s infotainment system. Understand how CarPlay is designed to work with your carâ€™s resources including the display, speakers, microphone, user inputs, steering wheel controls, instrument cluster and sensors.

Weâ€™ll go over how to make your game look stunning on different displays, tailor your input and controls to be intuitive on each device, and take advantage of Apple technologies that deliver great player experiences.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Accelerate machine learning with Metal

abstract.text: Discover how you can use Metal to accelerate your PyTorch model training on macOS. Weâ€™ll take you through updates to TensorFlow training support, explore the latest features and operations of MPS Graph, and share best practices to help you achieve great performance for all your machine learning needs.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Implement App Store Offers

abstract.text: Learn how to engage customers with App Store Offers using App Store Connect, as well as the latest StoreKit features and APIs. Discover how you can set up win-back offers (a new way to re-engage previous subscribers) and generate offer codes for Mac apps. And find out how to test offers in sandbox and Xcode to make sure they work smoothly.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Build device-to-device interactions with Network Framework

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Meet ClassKit for file-based apps

abstract.text: The ClassKit framework can help surface educational activities within your app to teachers using the Schoolwork app. Discover how you can provide teachers with greater insights into student learning by adopting the latest file-based API to report student progress data within your app. Weâ€™ll also show you how to use ClassKit to report out different data types, and how to test your implementation in developer mode.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Streamline local authorization flows

abstract.text: Discover how you can use the latest authorization-focused APIs in LocalAuthentication to protect the privacy and security of peopleâ€™s data. Weâ€™ll show you how LocalAuthentication can authorize access to secrets, keys, and other sensitive resources in your app, all while reducing complexity and relying on the security and usability of common local authentication methods such as Touch ID and Face ID.

EDR is Appleâ€™s High Dynamic Range representation and rendering pipeline. Explore how you can render HDR content using EDR in your app and unleash the dynamic range capabilities of your HDR display including Appleâ€™s internal displays and Pro Display XDR.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Explore HDR rendering with EDR
Add personality to your app through UX writing

Weâ€™ll help you get specific about your appâ€™s purpose and audience and practice writing in different tones.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Whatâ€™s new in App Intents

abstract.text: Learn about improvements and refinements to App Intents, and discover how this framework can help you expose your appâ€™s functionality to Siri and all-new features. Weâ€™ll show you how to make your entities more meaningful to the platform with the Transferable API, File Representations, new IntentFile APIs, and Spotlight Indexing, opening up powerful functionality in Siri and the Shortcuts app. Empower your intents to take people deep into your app with URL Representable Entities. doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Use Core ML Tools for machine learning model compression

Learn how to use techniques like palettization, pruning, and quantization to dramatically reduce model size while still achieving great accuracy. Explore comparisons between compression during the training stages and on fully trained models, and learn how compressed models can run even faster when your app takes full advantage of the Apple Neural Engine.

HealthKit provides you the tools to smartly manage health data anywhere, whether across multiple HealthKit-enabled devices such as iPhone and Apple Watch or with an external server to share data across a care team. In this session, weâ€™ll dive into managing data versions via HealthKitâ€™s built-in sync identifier metadata, how to detect changes in health data using an HKAnchoredObjectQuery, and cover best practices for ensuring youâ€™re always working with the right data everywhere.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Synchronize health data with HealthKit
Bring keyboard and mouse gaming to iPad

abstract.text: Level up your iPad games and add in keyboard, mouse, and trackpad controls. Discover how to use the Game Controller framework to augment your existing titles, bring over games from other platforms, or dream up entirely new interaction experiences. Learn how to integrate keyboard and â€œdeltaâ€ mouse coordinate events for player motion, and disable pointer system gestures like the Dock or Control Center to take full advantage of full screen gameplay.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Extend Your Appâ€™s Presence With Sharing

abstract.text: Help your users share the great content in your app by using the built-in iOS sharing functionality. Learn how timing, placement and context of sharing can drive engagement and acquire new users.

In a managed device environment, you often need to control the pace of software updates while you test the latest operating systems within your company or education institution. Discover the tools you have at your disposal to defer, deploy, and enforce software updates.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Manage software updates in your organization

Weâ€™ll also show you how to test your model with iPhone and iPad in live preview using Continuity Camera, and share how you can take Action Classification even further with the new Repetition Counting capabilities of the Create ML Components framework.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Explore Apple Business Essentials

abstract.text: Learn more about Apple Business Essentials â€” a complete solution that brings together device management, 24/7 support, and cloud storage for your small business. Weâ€™ll explore how you can use features like Collections to manage apps and settings for every iPhone, iPad, Mac, and Apple TV in your organization. doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Harness Apple GPUs with Metal

Discover how you can iterate upon your interfaces even more quickly when building your apps. Weâ€™ll show you how you can preview common customizations with accessibility overrides â€” such as dynamic type size and increased contrast â€” all without leaving the canvas. doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Explore Computer Vision APIs
Get Started with Display P3

Explore how to take advantage of Metal render command encoders, tile shading, unified memory architecture, and memoryless attachments. Weâ€™ll show you how to use Appleâ€™s unique tile based deferred renderer architecture to create power efficient apps with low memory footprint, and take you through best practices when migrating your compute-based apps from discrete GPUs to Apple silicon.

Harness the power of RealityKit through the process of building a spatial drawing app. As you create an eye-catching spatial experience that integrates RealityKit with ARKit and SwiftUI, youâ€™ll explore how resources work in RealityKit and how to use features like low-level mesh and texture APIs to achieve fast updates of the usersâ€™ brush strokes.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Build a spatial drawing app with RealityKit

Discover how you can use ARKitâ€™s tracking and scene understanding features to develop a whole new universe of immersive apps and games. doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Meet ARKit for spatial computing

abstract.text: Itâ€™s more important than ever to consider vulnerabilities and potential threats and recognize where you should apply safeguards in your app. Understand how to identify potential risks through threat modeling and how to avoid common anti-patterns. Learn coding techniques and how to take advantage of platform-supplied protections to help you mitigate risk and protect people while theyâ€™re using your app.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Secure your app: threat modeling and anti-patterns

abstract.text: Discover powerful new ways to customize volumes and immersive spaces in visionOS. Learn to fine-tune how volumes resize and respond to people moving around them. Get your gameâ€™s interface ready for Game Center. Learn how to customize your gameâ€™s access point, design collectible card-style achievements and multiple leaderboards, and adapt your interface for all platforms and orientations.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Design for Game Center
Whatâ€™s new in Safari extensions

Learn how to develop custom hover effects that update views when people look at them. Find out how to build an expanding button effect that combines opacity, scale, and clip effects. Discover best practices for creating effects that are comfortable and respect peopleâ€™s accessibility needs.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Create custom hover effects in visionOS

Discover Calendar and EventKit

Weâ€™ll also take you through some of the changes to calendar access levels that help your app stay connected without compromising the privacy of someoneâ€™s calendar data.

Dan Harris is an Emmy Award-winning journalist and the co-anchor of ABCâ€™s weekend editions of Good Morning America. After having a nationally-televised panic attack in 2004, he found himself on a long and often bizarre journey that ended with him discovering mindfulness meditation. Dan will share his story, which has led to his authoring two books and creating a popular podcast and app that have helped many (including previous non-believers like himself) improve their lives. He will be joined by Jeff Warren, renowned meditation teacher and Danâ€™s co-author of the bestselling book Meditation For Fidgety Skeptics, to offer practical steps that anyone can take to manage the wide-ranging stresses and anxieties of todayâ€™s world to become 10% happier.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Meditation for fidgety skeptics

abstract.text: Every app uses Buttons. With iOS 15, you can adopt updated styles to create gorgeous buttons that fit effortlessly into your interface. Weâ€™ll explore features that make it easier to create different types of buttons, learn how to provide richer interactions, and discover how you can get great buttons when using Mac Catalyst.

abstract.text: Discover how to distribute your apps directly to App Store Connect and all the distribution methods supported in Xcode. doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Distribute apps in Xcode with cloud signing

abstract.text: Learn how you can design your app to support SharePlay experiences. doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Design for Group Activities

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Qualities of great iPad and iPhone apps on Macs with M1

abstract.text: Discover proposed schema and structure updates to the Universal Scene Description (USD) standard. doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Whatâ€™s new in USD

abstract.text: Discover the latest enhancements to accelerated ML training in Metal. Find out about updates to PyTorch and TensorFlow, and learn about Metal acceleration for JAX. doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Optimize machine learning for Metal apps

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Evolve your Core Data schema

The Apple Design Awards honors excellence in innovation, ingenuity, and technical achievement in app and game design. Watch along as we reveal and celebrate the 2022 winners.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Apple Design Awards

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Whatâ€™s new in notarization for Mac apps

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Design App Intents for system experiences

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Whatâ€™s new in Core NFC
